intro: Clerodendrum macrophyllum, commonly known as the large-leaved glorybower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can grow up to 30 cm in length. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from red to pink, often appearing in clusters. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Clerodendrum macrophyllum is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many other ornamental and economically important plants.
